channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ZOOKEEPER-1953] Add solution and project files to enable build with current Visual Studio editions (VS 2012/2013) - 32-bit and 64-bit.
item.description: Add solution and project files to enable build with current Visual Studio editions (VS 2012/2013) - 32-bit and 64-bit.
item.summary: Add solution and project files to enable build with current Visual Studio editions (VS 2012/2013) - 32-bit and 64-bit.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Attached a file from ZOOKEEPER-1918 (moved)

Can someone test this and report if it's working for them? I have no way of doing so.

Also, Orion Hodson does this replace the existing build for windows or is it in addition to? – will the original build still work for prior versions of VS?

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12653751/ZOOKEEPER-1953.patch
against trunk revision 1607524.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed core unit tests.

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/2169//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/2169//artifact/trunk/build/test/findbugs/newPatchFindbugsWarnings.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/2169//console

This message is automatically generated.

Thanks Patrick Hunt for creating a separate ticket for this.

The patch adds a separate solution and project files for VS2013 and keeps the existing VS2008 ones. It has support for x86 and x64 platforms. It should build with the free version of Visual Studio 2013 Express for Desktop:

http://www.visualstudio.com/en-us/products/visual-studio-express-vs.aspx

The added solution and project files should also work with VS2012 - replace the string v120 with v110 in the project files so appropriate build dependencies are picked up.
I think we should include this - Michi Mutsuzaki any concerns/objections?

There is another patch to replace ZOOKEEPER_HOME environment variable with $(ProjectDir) macro. We probably want to do something similar here. Other than that, the patch looks good to me.

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-1915

Following feedback Michi Mutsuzaki - removed ZOOKEEPER_HOME. Previously, the project file defined a default that allowed build without user having to define value as in issue reported in:

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-1915
Patch https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12654300/ZOOKEEPER-1953-1.patch removes the ZOOKEEPER_HOME property.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12654300/ZOOKEEPER-1953-1.patch
against trunk revision 1607774.

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed core unit tests.

+1 contrib tests. The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/2176//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/2176//artifact/trunk/build/test/findbugs/newPatchFindbugsWarnings.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-ZOOKEEPER-Build/2176//console

This message is automatically generated.
+1, Committed revision 1609730.

FAILURE: Integrated in ZooKeeper-trunk #2370 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/ZooKeeper-trunk/2370/)
ZOOKEEPER-1953. Add solution and project files to enable build with current Visual Studio editions (VS 2012/2013)- 32-bit and 64-bit. (Orion Hodson via fpj) (fpj: http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/?root=Apache-SVN&view=rev&rev=1609730)

  • /zookeeper/trunk/CHANGES.txt
  • /zookeeper/trunk/src/c/Cli.vcxproj
  • /zookeeper/trunk/src/c/Cli.vcxproj.filters
  • /zookeeper/trunk/src/c/zookeeper-vs2013.sln
  • /zookeeper/trunk/src/c/zookeeper.vcxproj
  • /zookeeper/trunk/src/c/zookeeper.vcxproj.filters

I just pulled this onto my Mac and Git is unhappy with the new files under src/c. I believe it's due to them being checked in with Windows-style line endings. I'm trying to work out how to use the Git configuration and/or .gitattributes to cope. The symptoms are:

  • The five new files show up as locally modified for git status even though I am up-to-date with trunk.
  • The following warning appears:

noformat
warning: CRLF will be replaced by LF in src/c/Cli.vcxproj.
The file will have its original line endings in your working directory.
noformat

Bill Havanki, do either of these help?

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5834014/lf-will-be-replaced-by-crlf-in-git-what-is-that-and-is-it-important
http://www.rtuin.nl/2013/02/how-to-make-git-ignore-different-line-endings/
I'd rather not revert these changes. If there is any fix we need to check in, let's open a new jira, please.
I'm seeing the same issue on my Linux box. I believe Hongchao Deng recently fixed a similar issue on branch-3.4 - Hongchao can you shed any light?
Flavio Junqueira it might be better to revert the change if we can't fix it immediately. It's going to impact anyone trying to create patches on git. We can re-commit it once the issue is addressed.

It's caused by inconsistency of line ending between windows (CRLF) and linux/unix (LF).

Basically, rules in "$

{PROJECT}

/.gitattributes" will be enforced by git but not svn. If a file with CRLF but gitattributes say that it should be LF, git will transform it to LF automatically. It looks like the commit introduces changes that doesn't follow the rules..

Thanks for the links, Orion Hodson. From looking at those and others, and messing around some, I was able to eliminate the warnings by temporarily adding to .gitattributes:

*.vcxproj -text
*.vcxproj.filters -text
zookeeper-vs2013.sln -text

Oddly, even after removing those changes, the warnings stay gone.

(I can get the warnings back by deleting the five files and doing a git reset --hard HEAD. Temporarily modifying .gitattributes fixes it again. So weird.)

I think the best course of action is to update the new files to be "normalized" in Git (i.e., in the Git repository) to have LF endings, and to add .gitattributes entries for them akin to what's there for other files that require CRLF:

*.vcxproj text merge=union eol=crlf
*.vcxproj.filters text merge=union eol=crlf

I should mention that this article is very good at explaining the details of these issues:

http://adaptivepatchwork.com/2012/03/01/mind-the-end-of-your-line/

Thanks Bill Havanki . I've opened a new JIRA ticket and attached a patch that backs out the line endings for SVN and includes your gitattributes changes for *.vcxproj and *.vcproj.filters. The goal being to fix upstream in SVN and have that ripple through to the Apache git repo. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-1966.
